sections.title: Dentures
sections.body:
Dentures are removable appliances used to replace missing teeth.

They can restore appearance, support speech and chewing, and help maintain facial structure where teeth have been lost over time.

At St Mary’s House Dental Care, dentures are planned carefully, with a focus on comfort, function, and realistic expectations.
bullets: Removable appliances designed to replace missing teeth.
Help maintain facial structure over time.
Planned carefully for comfort, function, and realistic expectations.

sections.title: Measured fittings with honest conversations
items: Consultations that explain acrylic, chrome, and PEEK options in plain language
Bite, speech, and comfort checks built into each fitting
Guidance on adhesives, relines, and realistic retention
Clinician-led adjustments to reduce rubbing or pressure points
Follow-up support if stability changes over time

sections.title: Types of dentures
sections.body:
There are different types of dentures available, depending on how many teeth are being replaced and how they’re supported.

Options may include partial dentures that fit around remaining teeth or full dentures that replace all teeth in an arch.

We’ll explain the differences clearly so you understand what each option can and can’t do.
bullets: Partial dentures fit around remaining teeth for targeted replacement.
Full dentures replace all teeth in an arch.
Clear explanation of what each option can and can’t do.

sections.title: When dentures may be considered
items: Recommended when several teeth are missing or other replacement options are not suitable.
Used as a long-term solution or as part of a staged plan while other treatment is considered.
We explain why dentures are suggested and what alternatives may exist.

sections.title: Planning and fit
items: Assess remaining teeth and gums to understand support.
Consider how the denture will function during everyday use.
Attention to detail improves comfort and stability.
sections.strapline: Successful dentures rely on careful planning and accurate fit.

sections.title: Comfort and adjustment
sections.body:
It’s normal for dentures to take time to get used to.

Some initial soreness or changes in speech can occur, and adjustments are often part of the process.

We’ll review fit and comfort and make refinements as needed.

sections.title: Looking after dentures
items: Regular cleaning and care keep dentures comfortable and hygienic.
We explain how to clean them properly, when to remove them, and how to look after the supporting tissues.
Routine reviews help ensure dentures continue to fit well over time.

faqs.question: What if I’m unsure what to expect?
faqs.answer: Considering dentures can raise questions or concerns, particularly if you’ve never worn them before. If you’re unsure what to expect or whether dentures are right for you, we encourage you to ask. Clear understanding supports better long-term decisions.

sections.title: Alternatives and limitations
sections.body:
Dentures are not the only way to replace missing teeth.

Depending on your situation, alternatives such as bridges or dental implants may be discussed.

Each option has benefits and limitations, and we’ll help you weigh these up realistically.
bullets: Dentures are one option for replacing missing teeth.
Alternatives such as bridges or dental implants may be discussed.
We’ll help you weigh benefits and limitations realistically.
